p: In this study, we found that the wild mushrooms with the highest content of β-glucans determined with the Congo red method were Lactarius deliciosus (17.11 g/100 g DM) and Suillus grevillei (16.96 g/100 g DM). The content of these compounds was slightly higher compared to mushrooms of proven medical importance ( Pleurotus ostreatus −12.39 g/100 g DM) ( Table 2) and significantly higher compared to other medicinal species: Agaricus bisporus (3.12 g/100 g DM) and Lentinula edodes (8.42 g/100 g DM) ( Table 2).
